intro: Psychotria graminifolia, commonly known as the "grassleaf psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties. Psychotria graminifolia is often found in humid lowland forests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
